sentences.text: The next parliamentary elections in Moldova are to be held on 28 September 2025.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=16 Apr 2025 |title=Alegerile parlamentare vor avea loc pe 28 septembrie |url=https://tribuna.md/2025/04/16/alegerile-parlamentare-vor-avea-loc-pe-28-septembrie/ |access-date=16 Apr 2025 |website=tribuna.md}}</ref>

sentences.text: The 2021 Moldovan parliamentary election|last parliamentary election in Moldova was held on 11 July 2021, resulting in a landslide victory for the Pro-Europeanism|pro-European Party of Action and Solidarity (PAS), led by President Maia Sandu. PAS secured 63 out of 101 seats, allowing it to form a single-party majority government. The election marked a significant shift towards Moldova–European Union relations|European integration, as PAS defeated the Bloc of Communists and Socialists, a pro-Russian electoral alliance.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |title=Pro-Western party wins Moldova election, preliminary data shows |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/moldovans-elect-new-parliament-amid-concerns-over-graft-stalled-reforms-2021-07-11/ |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20231117133610/https://www.reuters.com/world/moldovans-elect-new-parliament-amid-concerns-over-graft-stalled-reforms-2021-07-11/ |archive-date=2023-11-17 |access-date=2025-02-20 |work=Reuters |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text: Since coming to power, the Party of Action and Solidarity|PAS-led government has pursued anti-corruption measures, judicial reforms, and European Union integration. Pro-Russian opposition forces have organized protests against the government’s economic policies.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Moldova: Start of Formal Accession Negotiations with the EU |url=https://dgap.org/en/research/publications/moldova-start-formal-accession-negotiations-eu |access-date=2025-02-20 |website=DGAP }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-02-20 |title=Pro-Russia protesters take to streets in Moldova to denounce new government |url=https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20230220-pro-russia-protesters-take-to-streets-in-moldova |access-date=2025-02-20 |website=France 24 |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: In the 2024 Moldovan presidential election|2024 presidential election, incumbent Maia Sandu was re-elected with 55.3% of the vote, defeating pro-Russian candidate Alexandr Stoianoglo. The election was overshadowed by allegations of Russian interference, with authorities seizing illegal propaganda materials. Alongside the election, Moldova held a 2024 Moldovan European Union membership referendum|referendum on EU integration, which narrowly passed with 50.4% support.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Balmforth |first=Tom |last2=Tanas |first2=Alexander |date=November 4, 2024 |title=Moldova's pro-Western Sandu claims election win after meddling allegations |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/moldova-holds-presidential-runoff-election-amid-claims-russian-meddling-2024-11-03/ |website=Reuters}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=Luxmoore |first=Matthew |date=October 21, 2024 |title=In Moldova, a Pro-Russian Oligarch With a Criminal Past Tries to Derail Path to Europe |url=https://www.wsj.com/world/europe/in-moldova-a-pro-russian-oligarch-with-a-criminal-past-tries-to-derail-path-to-europe-a000bf12? |website=The Wall Street Journal}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |date=2024-10-21 |title=Moldova narrowly votes for EU membership amid claims of 'unprecedented' Russian interference |url=https://www.abc.net.au/news/2024-10-22/moldova-votes-for-eu-membership-amid-russian-meddling-claims/104500056 |access-date=2025-02-20 |work=ABC News |language=en-AU}}</ref>

sentences.text: Moldova is grappling with major security and economic challenges, notably including energy security issues due to disrupted Russia in the European energy sector|gas supplies from Russia. The Russian invasion of Ukraine|2022 Russian invasion of neighboring Ukraine has  triggering a massive influx of refugees into Moldova. These difficulties have amplified the significance of the 2025 parliamentary elections; for President Sandu, according to Euronews, the election would be "a final battle" on Moldova's road to European Union|EU membership.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-12-31 |title='No heating, no light': Moldovans fear looming energy shortage as Russia halts gas supplies |url=https://apnews.com/article/moldova-energy-crisis-russia-transnistria-gas-europe-3cb90f12ad5274bda67f99a1c4619abf |access-date=2025-02-20 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=Balmforth |first=Tom |last2=Tanas |first2=Alexander |date=November 4, 2024 |title=Moldova's Sandu promises to bring change after narrow runoff win |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/moldovas-sandu-says-she-will-press-change-after-narrow-runoff-win-2024-11-04/ |website=Reuters}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-12-31 |title=From Germany to Romania: Elections that will define Europe in 2025 |url=https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2024/12/31/from-germany-to-romania-the-elections-that-will-define-europe-in-2025 |access-date=2025-02-20 |website=euronews |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: The 101 members of Parliament of Moldova|Parliament are elected by party-list proportional representation in a single nationwide constituency. The electoral threshold at the national level varies according to the type of list; for parties or individual organizations it is 5%; for an electoral bloc it is 7%. For independent candidates, the threshold is 2%.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=CE325/2022 |url=https://www.legis.md/cautare/getResults?doc_id=134589&lang=ro |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20240913105927/https://www.legis.md/cautare/getResults?doc_id=134589&lang=ro |archive-date=2024-09-13 |access-date=2025-04-16 |website=www.legis.md |language=ro}}</ref>

sentences.text: According to Moldova’s intelligence chief, Alexandru Musteata, the election is expected to face significant interference from Russia. He warned that Moscow is likely to employ the tactics used during the 2024 Moldovan presidential election|2024 presidential election and the 2024 Moldovan European Union membership referendum|EU referendum, including disinformation campaigns, financial support for Russophilia|pro-Russian parties, and other covert efforts to destabilize Moldova’s democratic process. The Moldovan government has expressed its determination to counter these threats.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-12-13 |title=Moldovan spy chief: Russia will try to interfere in 2025 parliamentary election, too |url=https://www.politico.eu/article/moldovan-spy-chief-russia-will-try-interfere-parliamentary-elections-next-year-alexandru-musteata/ |access-date=2025-02-21 |website=POLITICO |language=en-GB}}</ref>

sentences.text: Moldovan opposition leader Alexandr Stoianoglo, who lost the 2024 Moldovan presidential election|2024 presidential election to President Maia Sandu, announced{{when|date=April 2025}} the formation of a new coalition to challenge the pro-Western ruling majority. The coalition, called Alternative (political bloc)|Alternative, unites three political parties led by Chisinau Mayor Ion Ceban, former Prime Minister Ion Chicu, and former lawmaker Mark Tkachuk.

references.text: <ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Tanas |first=Alexander |date=February 1, 2025 |title=Moldovan opposition leader forms coalition to challenge Sandu at parliament election |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/moldovan-opposition-leader-forms-coalition-challenge-sandu-parliament-election-2025-01-31/ |website=Reuters}}</ref>

sentences.text: While Stoianoglo campaigns on a foreign policy that includes both Russia and the West, he has leaned toward Russophilia|Russia, with his past presidential candidacy backed by the pro-Moscow Party of Socialists of the Republic of Moldova|PSRM. Meanwhile, tensions between Moldova and Russia remain high, with accusations of Russia attempting to interfere in past elections and of worsening Moldova's 2025 Moldovan energy crisis|energy crisis.<ref name=":1" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-10-30 |title=Sandu and Stoianoglo face off in crucial Moldova presidential runoff |url=https://www.euronews.com/my-europe/2024/10/30/moldovas-presidential-race-pro-eu-and-russia-friendly-candidates-face-off-in-crucial-runof |access-date=2025-02-21 |website=euronews |language=en}}</ref>
